<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Used to differentiate between target-specific &quot;direct&quot; flags and &quot;bitmask&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// flags. A machine operand can only have one &quot;direct&quot; flag, but can have</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a03a83eb6d12005ac7d43d370f4eb5078a54a53e14720548a9a542da056797792d"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a03a83eb6d12005ac7d43d370f4eb5078a54a53e14720548a9a542da056797792d">MO&#95;RELAX</a> = 64</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Given a MachineOperand that may carry out &quot;bitmask&quot; flags, such as MO&#95;RELAX,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Add MO&#95;RELAX &quot;bitmask&quot; flag when FeatureRelax is enabled.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Target-specific flags of LAInst.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All definitions must match LoongArchInstrFormats.td.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Whether the instruction&#39;s rd is normally required to differ from rj and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// rk, in the way the 3-register atomic memory operations behave</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (Section 2.2.7.1 and 2.2.7.2, LoongArch Reference Manual Volume 1 v1.10;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// while Section 2.2.7.3 lacked similar description for the AMCAS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instructions, at least the INE exception is still signaled on Loongson</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 3A6000 when its rd == rj).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Used for generating diagnostics for assembler input that violate the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constraint. As described on the manual, the covered instructions require</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// rd != rj &amp;&amp; rd != rk to work as intended.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738a286ed93291ef31d4d11c04e96126b23d"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738a286ed93291ef31d4d11c04e96126b23d">IsSubjectToAMORdConstraintShift</a> = 0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738ab792d4fa2c40e2ed4c2119ca402b74fc"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738ab792d4fa2c40e2ed4c2119ca402b74fc">IsSubjectToAMORdConstraintMask</a> = 1 &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738a286ed93291ef31d4d11c04e96126b23d">IsSubjectToAMORdConstraintShift</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Whether the instruction belongs to the AMCAS family.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738af1cb94b353279a3a957b0a63e7dcbf3b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738af1cb94b353279a3a957b0a63e7dcbf3b">IsAMCASShift</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738a286ed93291ef31d4d11c04e96126b23d">IsSubjectToAMORdConstraintShift</a> + 1,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738a46be2cc5190008faeac52cd5dd937b43"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738a46be2cc5190008faeac52cd5dd937b43">IsAMCASMask</a> = 1 &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738af1cb94b353279a3a957b0a63e7dcbf3b">IsAMCASShift</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\returns true if this instruction&#39;s rd is normally required to differ</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from rj and rk, in the way 3-register atomic memory operations behave.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a4875afc76f72cb9aea2d71bca9062f30"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a4875afc76f72cb9aea2d71bca9062f30">isSubjectToAMORdConstraint</a>(uint64&#95;t TSFlags) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> TSFlags &amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loongarchii/#a1b3c5f4543d57e05692d5af0fbe96738ab792d4fa2c40e2ed4c2119ca402b74fc">IsSubjectToAMORdConstraintMask</a>;</span></CodeLine>
